events.message: Execute command specified by -coinbaser when creating a new block, which can output data to control where the generation goes
coinbaser: replace %d in command line with available funds
Replace nBits in coinbase scriptSig with arbitrary data set by setworkaux RPC call
Bugfix/safeguard: never create a coinbase scriptSig over 100 bytes long
Check for parse or overflow errors in setworkaux

Merge commit '96f9693' into coinbaser

	src/main.h

issue.title: Coinbaser
issue.body:
Allow customizing what addresses are paid by generation, with failover to the standard "50 BTC to me" behaviour; also adds the "setworkaux" JSON-RPC call to add arbitrary data to the coinbase, which can be used to implement merged-mining (has safeguards against creating invalid coinbases)

The internal code changes for "setworkaux" can also be used to put "feature flags" in coinbases, to enable upgrades (like OP_EVAL) when X% of the last Y blocks advertise support (after which, they should stop advertising the flag to make room for future content).

Eligius has tested this changeset quite a bit under the 0.3.23 codebase.

The "setauxwork" JSON-RPC method has support for addition: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=46927.0

events.body:
Closing, but we can re-open if there is sufficient buy-in from other mining operations.

If accepted, would lean towards _only_ using TCP, as external program execution is more complicated and less portable (Windows does not have an exec, strictly speaking, so spawning details differ).
Um, wtf? This was already accepted for 0.6
